qas.question: Where was the 62nd AES Convention held?
Who was the general manger of Sony's audio department in 1971?
What year did Sony first exhibit the use of an optical digital audio disc?
Where was the Philips Introduce Compact disc conference held?
What did Nakajima's team use to create a digital PCM adaptor audio tape recorder?
When did Sony release it's AES technical paper?
What Japanese city is NHK located in?
Who was Sony's general manager in 1970?
When was the Betamax video recorder created?
How many minutes could Sony's 1976 optical digital disk play?
What was the sampling rate of Philips' 1979 optical digital dic?

context: <a1_0><b7_0>Heitaro Nakajima<b7_0/><a1_0/>, who developed an early digital audio recorder within Japan's national public broadcasting organization NHK in 1970, became general manager of Sony's audio department in 1971. His team developed a digital PCM adaptor audio tape recorder using a <a4_0>Betamax video recorder<a4_0/> in 1973. After this, in 1974 the leap to storing digital audio on an optical disc was easily made. Sony first publicly demonstrated an optical digital audio disc in September <a2_0><b8_0>1976<b8_0/><a2_0/>. A year later, in September 1977, Sony showed the press a 30 cm disc that could play <b9_0>60 minutes<b9_0/> of digital audio (44,100 Hz sampling rate and 16-bit resolution) using MFM modulation. In September 1978, the company demonstrated an optical digital audio disc with a 150-minute playing time, <b10_0>44,056 Hz<b10_0/> sampling rate, 16-bit linear resolution, and cross-interleaved error correction code—specifications similar to those later settled upon for the standard Compact Disc format in 1980. Technical details of Sony's digital audio disc were presented during the 62nd AES Convention, held on 13–16 March 1979, in <a0_0><b6_0>Brussels<b6_0/><a0_0/>. Sony's AES technical paper was published on <a5_0>1 March 1979<a5_0/>. A week later, on 8 March, Philips publicly demonstrated a prototype of an optical digital audio disc at a press conference called "Philips Introduce Compact Disc" in <a3_0>Eindhoven, Netherlands<a3_0/>.
